1#include <sys/param.h>
2#include <sys/time.h>
3#include <stdio.h>
4#include <string.h>
5#include <unistd.h>
6#include <stdlib.h>
7#include <err.h>
8#include <sysexits.h>
9#include <util.h>
10
11#include <netsmb/smb_lib.h>
12#include <netsmb/smb_conn.h>
13
14#include "common.h"
15
16static void help(void) __dead;
17static void help_usage(void) __dead;
18static int cmd_crypt(int, char *[]);
19static int cmd_help(int, char *[]);
20
21int verbose;
22
23typedef int (*cmd_fn_t)(int, char *[]);
24typedef void (*cmd_usage_t)(void) __dead;
25
26#define CMDFL_NO_KMOD 0x0001
27
28static struct commands {
29 const char * name;
30 cmd_fn_t fn;
31 cmd_usage_t usage;
32 int flags;
33} commands[] = {
34 { "crypt", cmd_crypt, NULL, CMDFL_NO_KMOD },
35 { "help", cmd_help, help_usage, CMDFL_NO_KMOD },
36 { "lc", cmd_dumptree, NULL, 0 },
37 { "login", cmd_login, login_usage, 0 },
38 { "logout", cmd_logout, logout_usage, 0 },
39 { "lookup", cmd_lookup, lookup_usage, CMDFL_NO_KMOD },
40 { "print", cmd_print, print_usage, 0 },
41 { "view", cmd_view, view_usage, 0 },
42 { NULL, NULL, NULL, 0 },
43};
44
45static struct commands *
46lookupcmd(const char *name)
47{
48 struct commands *cmd;
49
50 for (cmd = commands; cmd->name; cmd++) {
51 if (strcmp(cmd->name, name) == 0)
52 return cmd;
53 }
54 return NULL;
55}
56
57int
58cmd_crypt(int argc, char *argv[])
59{
60 char *cp, *psw;
61
62 if (argc < 2)
63 psw = getpass("Password:");
64 else
65 psw = argv[1];
66 cp = smb_simplecrypt(NULL, psw);
67 if (cp == NULL)
68 errx(EX_DATAERR, "out of memory");
69 printf("%s\n", cp);
70 free(cp);
71 exit(0);
72}
73
74int
75cmd_help(int argc, char *argv[])
76{
77 struct commands *cmd;
78 char *cp;
79
80 if (argc < 2)
81 help_usage();
82 cp = argv[1];
83 cmd = lookupcmd(cp);
84 if (cmd == NULL)
85 errx(EX_DATAERR, "unknown command %s", cp);
86 if (cmd->usage == NULL)
87 errx(EX_DATAERR, "no specific help for command %s", cp);
88 cmd->usage();
89 exit(0);
90}
91
92int
93main(int argc, char *argv[])
94{
95 struct commands *cmd;
96 char *cp;
97 int opt;
98#ifdef APPLE
99 extern void dropsuid();
100
101 dropsuid();
102#endif /* APPLE */
103
104 if (argc < 2)
105 help();
106
107 while ((opt = getopt(argc, argv, "hv")) != EOF) {
108 switch (opt) {
109 case 'h':
110 help();
111 /*NOTREACHED */
112 case 'v':
113 verbose = 1;
114 break;
115 default:
116 warnx("invalid option %c", opt);
117 help();
118 /*NOTREACHED */
119 }
120 }
121 if (optind >= argc)
122 help();
123
124 cp = argv[optind];
125 cmd = lookupcmd(cp);
126 if (cmd == NULL)
127 errx(EX_DATAERR, "unknown command %s", cp);
128
129 if ((cmd->flags & CMDFL_NO_KMOD) == 0 && smb_lib_init() != 0)
130 exit(1);
131
132 argc -= optind;
133 argv += optind;
134 optind = optreset = 1;
135 return cmd->fn(argc, argv);
136}
137
138static void
139help(void) {
140 printf("\n");
141 printf("Usage: %s [-hv] command [args]\n", getprogname());
142 printf("where commands are:\n"
143 " crypt [password] slightly encrypt password\n"
144 " help command display help on \"command\"\n"
145 " lc display active connections\n"
146 " login //user@host[/share] login to the specified host\n"
147 " logout //user@host[/share] logout from the specified host\n"
148 " print //user@host/share file print file to the specified remote printer\n"
149 " view //user@host list resources on the specified host\n"
150 "\n");
151 exit(1);
152}
153
154static void
155help_usage(void) {
156 fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s help command\n", getprogname());
157 exit(1);
158}
